item.description:
Our next hike, as suggested by Kasia, is Richmond, RI. She will lead us on the hike.

There's a couple of beautiful trails at the Carolina Management Area in Richmond, RI ( Exit 3A off of 95 once you get into RI). I've been hiking with Max there before and it's ideal for hiking with a small to large group with several dogs. There is a main trail with criscrossing smaller trails running beside it and it's about two-ish miles roundtrip. The trail path is wide and goes through tall, pine trees and fern vegetation. There's an option to take another trail too. The only thing is that horses and their riders frequent the trails at a slow pace and dogs and owners would have to be comfortable with them. The horses & riders that we've encountered have been very respectful. Also, the park allows dogs to be off leash (yay!); dogs only have to be on leash from March 15-August 15 and hunting season starts the 3rd Sat of October until the end of Feb.

Directions:
http://maps.google.co...

Info:
http://www.visitrhode...
item.name: Hiking in Richmond, RI at the Carolina Management Area
